overview: The purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds for the Kauhale Initiative and establish and appropriate funds into and out of the Supportive Housing Special Fund. [6] Your Committee has amended this measure by deleting the unspecified appropriation to the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to implement the Kauhale Initiative. [6]
appropriations: The committee has amended this measure by deleting the unspecified appropriation to the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to implement the Kauhale Initiative. [6]
agency_impact: The measure now requires at least two bidders for any kauhale project estimated to be over $1,000,000 (HB431_HD2_HSCR765_.htm.txt) if appropriated funds are used to contract for the procurement of building services and projects related to the Kauhale Initiative. [6]
policy_impact: Your Committee has amended this measure by expanding the authorized uses of funds appropriated for the Kauhale Initiative. [6] The amendments authorize funds appropriated for the Kauhale Initiative to be used for the Ohana Zones Pilot Program established under Act 209, Session Laws of Hawaii 2018. [6] Furthermore, the unspecified appropriation to the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions has been deleted. [6]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The fiscal outlook has been altered by the deletion of the unspecified appropriation to the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to implement the Kauhale Initiative. [6]
capital_expenditure_impact: A new procurement rule requires at least two bidders for any kauhale project estimated to be over $1,000,000 (HB431_HD2_HSCR765_.htm.txt) if appropriated funds are used for building services and projects related to the Kauhale Initiative. [6]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The committee amended the measure by expanding the authorized uses of funds appropriated for the Kauhale Initiative and authorizing these funds to be used for the Ohana Zones Pilot Program. [6] [6] A primary change is the deletion of the unspecified appropriation to the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [6] A new procurement requirement was added, mandating at least two bidders for any kauhale project estimated to be over $1,000,000 (HB431_HD2_HSCR765_.htm.txt). [6]
